metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14649 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
ReadOneJNGImage in coders/png.c in GraphicsMagick version 1.3.26 does not properly validate JNG data, leading to a denial of service (assertion failure in magick/pixel_cache.c, and application crash). It was discovered that GraphicsMagick incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-14649` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.26-12
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.26-12
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.26-12
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.26-12
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.26-12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.26-12').
